00020 //used for most colors
00021 struct ColorStruct
00022 {
00023         BYTE R, G, B;
00024 
00025         void operator = (ColorStruct Color)
00026         {
00027                 R = Color.R;
00028                 G = Color.G;
00029                 B = Color.B;
00030         }
00031 
00032         bool operator == (ColorStruct rhs)
00033         {
00034                 return R == rhs.R && G == rhs.G && B == rhs.B;
00035         }
00036 
00037         ColorStruct()
00038         {
00039         }
00040 
00041         ColorStruct(BYTE _R, BYTE _G, BYTE _B)
00042         {
00043                 R = _R;
00044                 G = _G;
00045                 B = _B;
00046         }
00047 };

00049 #ifndef PALETTE_STRUCT
00050 #define PALETTE_STRUCT
00051 struct BytePalette {
00052         ColorStruct Entries[256];
00053         ColorStruct & operator [](const int idx) {
00054                 return this->Entries[idx];

00089 //used for timed events, time measured in frames!
00090 class TimerStruct
00091 {
00092 public:
00093         int StartTime;
00094         int unknown;
00095         int TimeLeft;
00096 
00097         void Stop()
00098                 { this->StartTime = -1; this->TimeLeft = 0; }
00099 
00100         bool IsDone()
00101                 { return this->StartTime != -1 && this->GetTimeLeft() <= 0; }
00102 
00103         bool Ignorable()
00104                 { return this->StartTime == -1 || this->GetTimeLeft() <= 0; }
00105 
00106         int GetTimeLeft()
00107                 { JMP_THIS(0x426630); }
00108 
00109         void Start(int duration)
00110                 { JMP_THIS(0x46B640); }
00111 
00112         void StartIfEmpty() // just sets start frame
00113                 { JMP_THIS(0x6CE2C0); }
00114 };

00116 //also see FACING definitions
00117 struct FacingStruct
00118 {
00119         WORD Facing1; //current facing?
00120         WORD unused_2;
00121         WORD Facing2; //??
00122         WORD unused_6;
00123         TimerStruct Timer; //rotation?
00124         WORD ROT; //Rate of Turn. INI Value * 256
00125         WORD unused_16;
00126 
00127         DWORD GetFacing(DWORD *arg)
00128                 { JMP_THIS(0x4C93D0); }
00129 
00130         operator int() {
00131                 // <DCoder> I don't know how or what it does, but that's what the game uses
00132                 DWORD nessie;
00133                 this->GetFacing(&nessie); // mysterious facing value from the depths of the game
00134                 return (((nessie >> 7) + 1) >> 1) & 0xFF;
00135         }
00136 };
